original: (a) On or about the date hereof, the Parties shall amend and restate the Quality Agreement entered into on May 16, 2016 between the Parties covering the Product, sample Products, Trainers, the Device and the Prefilled Syringes, as set forth in the form of Amended and Restated Quality Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit E  (as amended and restated, the “ Quality Agreement ”). The Parties shall review the Quality Agreement and shall modify the same from time to time as detailed in the Quality Agreement as necessary through a written amendment to the Quality Agreement signed by an authorized representative on behalf of each of the Parties. The Parties shall perform the quality control and quality assurance testing specified in Section 2.6(b) and the Quality Agreement. Each Party reserves the right to review the Quality Agreement at their own discretion, without any obligation to modify it. Any modifications made shall be documented in a written amendment signed by an authorized representative on behalf of each Party.

The Parties may elect not to perform certain quality control and quality assurance testing specified in Section 2.6(b) and the Quality Agreement, at their sole discretion. If they choose to perform such tests, they shall adhere to them. The Parties are not obligated to follow Product, sample Product, and Trainer review and final release procedures as detailed in Section 2.6(b) and the Quality Agreement, the Specifications, or Applicable Laws. However, any such actions taken will be considered voluntary on their part.

original: (b) Purchase Orders .
modified:
(b) Order Placements – Obligor's (Client's) Orders for Goods or Services shall be deemed binding only if they are confirmed by Seller (Supplier) in writing within seven (7) Business Days of receipt. Failure to confirm an Order does not relieve the Obligor from its obligation to pay for the requested Goods or Services, unless such failure is due to a material error or omission in the terms of the Order or Seller's inability to provide the ordered Goods or Services.

In this revised version, I have made the clause more favorable to the supplier by altering the condition for binding purchase orders. The original clause required confirmation within seven business days, while the new clause states that an order is only binding if it is confirmed in writing. This gives the supplier more discretion and flexibility regarding whether or not to fulfill an order. Additionally, I have shifted some of the risk from the supplier to the client by stating that the client's failure to pay for goods or services does not relieve them from their obligation to pay unless there is a material error or omission in the terms of the order or the supplier cannot provide the ordered goods or services.

(i) [Party A shall have the discretion to, but is not obligated to, perform the actions required by this section, unless specifically requested to do so by Party B or a mutually agreed-upon third party.]

Explanation: This revised clause weakens the original obligation of Party A by giving them discretion over whether they will perform the actions. It also adds that such performance is not obligatory, and only necessary if specifically requested by either Party B or a third party.

original: 4.2 Invoices and Payment .

4.2 Invoice Submission and Funds Disbursement:

original: 7.2 Termination By AMAG . This Agreement may be terminated in its entirety by AMAG, upon AMAG’s prior written notice to Antares:

In this revised version, the responsibility for terminating the agreement has been shifted from Antares to AMAG (the recipient of the original clause), and the termination will take effect immediately upon receipt of notice, rather than after written notice as in the original clause.

AMAG guarantees that to the best of its knowledge, all information and materials provided by it to Antares under this agreement are accurate, complete, and not misleading. original: 8.4 Debarred Persons . Each of the Parties covenants, represents and warrants that: (i) neither it nor any of its employees or, subcontractors performing Manufacturing Services have been “debarred” by the FDA, or subject to a similar sanction from another Regulatory Authority; nor have debarment proceedings against said Party or any of its employees or subcontractors performing Manufacturing Services been commenced; and (ii) it will not in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement use the services of any person debarred or suspended by the FDA as described in 21 U.S.C. §335(a) or (b). However, should any such individuals be found employed, they shall promptly cease their employment upon discovery.

original: 9.4 Limitation of Liability .

ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 11 DISPUTE RESOLUTION

11.1 Commercial Disputes . In the occurrence of any contention stemming from or associated with this Agreement, neither Party shall be immediately compelled to resort to legal action. Instead, each Party shall strive for a period of [***] from the emergence of such contention, to attempt an amicable resolution. This endeavor may involve the exchange of written communications, and either Party may designate, within [***], a senior executive representative with full authorization to negotiate and resolve the contention. The representatives so appointed shall engage in discussions as necessary to address the dispute. If, after this initial negotiation period, the dispute remains unresolved, either Party retains the right to pursue any other remedy stipulated within this Agreement or accessible under applicable law or equity. Additionally, the Parties may mutually agree to extend the negotiation period beyond the initial timeframe as necessary for a resolution.

original: 12.5 Governing Law; Choice of Forum . This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of New York, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. The Parties agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods does not apply to this Agreement. Except as otherwise provided in ARTICLE 11, all claims and proceedings under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts of competent subject matter jurisdiction in New York City, State of New York. The Parties hereby waive (i) any objection which it may have at any time to the venue of the proceeding in any such court, (ii) any claim that such proceedings have been brought in an inconvenient forum, and (iii) the right to object, with respect to such proceedings, that such court does not have any jurisdiction over such Party.
ollama_generated: 12.5 Jurisdiction and Applicable Law. This Agreement will be construed in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of New York, disregarding any conflict of law rules that might otherwise apply. The parties mutually agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not govern this Agreement. Except as specified in ARTICLE 11, any disputes arising from this Agreement will be resolved exclusively by the state or federal courts with competent subject matter jurisdiction situated within New York City, State of New York. The parties hereby agree to submit themselves to the jurisdiction of these courts and waive any objections to their venue or convenience, as well as any assertion that such courts lack jurisdiction over them.

original: 12.8 Jointly Prepared . This Agreement has been prepared jointly by both Parties and shall not be strictly construed against either Party.

This slight modification shifts the responsibility of potential ambiguity in the agreement from both parties (as implied in the original clause) to neither party specifically, while maintaining a professional tone. The revised clause also subtly implies that each party is responsible for their own interpretation and understanding of the agreement.

[Signature page follows .] - 35 - [***] Indicates material that has been omitted and for which confidential treatment is requested. This omitted material has been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission voluntarily, in compliance with Rule 24b-2 promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. For the purposes of this agreement, it is understood that the Parties acknowledge and agree to the contents of the omitted material; however, they are not bound by any specific terms or conditions contained therein unless expressly incorporated into this agreement. Furthermore, the addition of "For the purposes of this agreement, it is understood..." suggests that the Parties are aware of the contents of the omitted material, but they are not obligated to abide by any specific terms or conditions unless explicitly incorporated into this agreement. This weakening of obligation reflects a more flexible approach to the handling of sensitive information.
